member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ProductInfo.GetProductInfo
member.summary: For .NET framework below netframework462, there are assembly binding issues when referencing netstandard assemblies, https://github.com/Azure/azure-signalr/issues/452 For now, disable usage of System.Runtime.InteropServices.RuntimeInformation

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceConnection.CleanupClientConnections(System.String)
member.summary: Cleanup the client connections
member.param: Specifies which Azure SignalR instance is the client connections come from, null means all

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions
member.summary: Configurable options when using Azure SignalR Service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection string of Azure SignalR Service instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions.ConnectionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial number of connections per hub from SDK to Azure SignalR Service. Default value is 5. Usually keep it as the default value is enough. During runtime, the SDK might start new server connections for performance tuning or load balancing. When you have big number of clients, you can give it a larger number for better throughput.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions.InitialHubServerConnectionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial number of connections per hub from SDK to Azure SignalR Service. Default value is 5. Usually keep it as the default value is enough. When you have big number of clients, you can give it a larger number for better throughput. During runtime, the SDK might start new server connections for performance tuning or load balancing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions.MaxHubServerConnectionCount
member.summary: Specifies the max server connection count allowed per hub from SDK to Azure SignalR Service. During runtime, the SDK might start new server connections for performance tuning or load balancing. By default a new server connection starts whenever needed. When the max allowed server connection count is configured, the SDK does not start new connections when server connection count reaches the limit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets applicationName, which will be used as a prefix to apply to each hub name

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions.ClaimsProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the func to generate claims from . The claims will be included in the auto-generated token for clients.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions.DiagnosticClientFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets the func to set diagnostic client filter from . The clients will be regarded as diagnostic client only if the function returns true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions.AccessTokenLifetime
member.summary: Gets or sets the lifetime of auto-generated access token, which will be used to authenticate with Azure SignalR Service. Default value is one hour.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions.AccessTokenAlgorithm
member.summary: Gets or sets the access token generate algorithm, supports HmacSha256 or HmacSha512 Default value is HmacSha256

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions.Endpoints
member.summary: Customize the multiple endpoints used

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions.ServerStickyMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode for server sticky, when client is always routed to the server which it first /negotiate with, we call it "server sticky mode". By default this mode is disabled

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions.Proxy
member.summary: Gets or sets the proxy used when ServiceEndpoint will attempt to connect to Azure SignalR.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.ServiceOptions.MaxPollIntervalInSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval in seconds used by the Azure SignalR Service to timeout idle LongPolling connections Default value is 5, limited to [1, 300].

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.AspNet.TraceManagerLoggerProvider.InternalTraceSourceLogger
member.summary: Use an InternalTraceSourceLogger to get rid of LogicalOperationStack inside the TraceSourceScope Slightly different from the TraceSourceLogger in that the message is prefixed with [categoryName]

member.name: M:Owin.OwinExtensions.MapAzureSignalR(Owin.IAppBuilder,System.String)
member.summary: Maps Azure SignalR hubs to the app builder pipeline at "/signalr".
member.param: The name of your app, it is case-insensitive.
member.remarks: The connection string is read from the ConnectionString section of application config (web.config or app.config), with name "Azure:SignalR:ConnectionString"
